scenarios.title: Prior Eviction and Low Credit
scenarios.description: A client with a prior eviction and a low credit score finds a suitable unit but fears automatic denial.
scenarios.question: What should staff do first to uphold low-barrier access?

options.A: Advise the client to give up and look elsewhere
options.C: Engage the landlord to negotiate screening criteria and offer risk mitigation

scenarios.explanation: The policy directs staff to negotiate barriers like evictions/credit and use risk mitigation (e.g., additional deposits, first/last month).

scenarios.title: Client Preference vs. Staff Preference
scenarios.description: A client prefers a unit farther from services due to proximity to family. Staff prefer a closer unit that is available sooner.
scenarios.question: How should staff proceed?

options.A: Override the client and place in the closer unit
options.B: Respect the client’s choice and support their preferred option
options.C: Delay both options until a perfect unit appears
options.D: Require a written justification from the client

scenarios.explanation: The policy emphasizes respecting client choice without imposing limitations based on market conditions or staff preference.

scenarios.title: Landlord Concern about Income Ratio
scenarios.description: A landlord requires a 3x income-to-rent ratio. The client’s income falls slightly below this threshold but rent is otherwise sustainable with supports.
scenarios.question: What is the best next step?

options.A: Abandon the unit due to policy
options.B: Ask the landlord to waive or adjust the ratio and offer risk mitigation
options.C: Suggest the client take on new debt to raise income

scenarios.explanation: Income-to-rent ratios are a negotiable screening criterion. Staff should negotiate and offer risk mitigation where appropriate.

scenarios.title: Supporting the Application Process
scenarios.description: A client is overwhelmed by the application process and unsure how to evaluate options.
scenarios.question: How should staff proceed according to procedures?

options.A: Select a unit on the client’s behalf and submit
options.B: Visit potential units with the client, review options, and assist with the application
options.C: Refer the client to a different program
options.D: Wait for the client to finish the process independently

scenarios.explanation: Procedures include engaging clients in selection, visiting units together, and assisting with applications.

scenarios.title: Criminal History Disclosure
scenarios.description: A client has an old misdemeanor. A landlord expresses concern and is considering denial.
scenarios.question: What is the most aligned response?

options.B: Encourage the client not to apply
options.C: Open a conversation to individualize consideration and propose risk mitigation
options.D: Ask the landlord to keep the requirement but raise the deposit excessively

scenarios.explanation: Staff should pursue individualized, reasonable consideration and propose risk mitigation to lower barriers.
